types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Node
types.description:
An object with an ID.
Follows the [Relay Global Object Identification Specification](https://relay.dev/graphql/objectidentification.htm)

types.name: OrderDirection
types.description: Possible directions in which to order a list of items when provided an `orderBy` argument.

enumValues.name: ASC
enumValues.description: Specifies an ascending order for a given `orderBy` argument.

enumValues.name: DESC
enumValues.description: Specifies a descending order for a given `orderBy` argument.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
Information about pagination in a connection.
https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-undefined.PageInfo

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: When paginating forwards, the cursor to continue.

types.name: PlayerConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Identifies the total count of items in the connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

types.name: PlayerWhereInput
types.description:
PlayerWhereInput is used for filtering Player objects.
Input was generated by ent.

fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: Lookup nodes by a list of IDs.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: where
args.description: Filtering options for Players returned from the connection.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: where
args.description: Filtering options for Users returned from the connection.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String`scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: UpdateUserInput
types.description:
UpdateUserInput is used for update User object.
Input was generated by ent.

types.name: UserConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of items.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Identifies the total count of items in the connection.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

types.name: UserWhereInput
types.description:
UserWhereInput is used for filtering User objects.
Input was generated by ent.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: The @deprecated built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to indicate deprecated portions of a GraphQL service's schema, such as deprecated fields on a type, arguments on a field, input fields on an input type, or values of an enum type.

directives.name: include
directives.description: The @include directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional inclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: The @specifiedBy built-in directive is used within the type system definition language to provide a scalar specification URL for specifying the behavior of custom scalar types.
